result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin J. Scheder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property >$5000 - $10,000 or Firearm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $200.00 fine plus costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered. **NOTE: $500.00 has been applied toward the fines/costs leaving a balance due of $280.00.
----------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------

No contact with gun owner or residence. No contact with Dino Nero, Lupe Medina, Mason Koch, Tyler Schearer. No drugs or drug paraphernalia.
----------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record. **NOTE: COURT IS GRANTING SPECIAL DISPOSITION WITH TWO ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
1. No early termination of Probation
2. Absolutely NO violations of Probation.
----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before January 22, 2015 @ 8:00 am. Conditional release jail time may be served in Dodge County.
The defendant is to complete a total of sixty (60) hours community service work during his term of probation with NO BUYOUT.

Defendant Austin J. Scheder in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a plea agreement.  Attorney Schwantes sets forth the terms of the agreement.  Matter will need to be put over for sentencing and the only issue to be argued is expungement.  Court has plea colloquy with Mr. Scheder.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds factual basis for entry of plea, accepts plea and adjudges the defendant guilty.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Subpoena - WFM

Defendant Austin J. Scheder in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No agreement, matter set for trial. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant appears in court with attorney Travis Schwantes. Haley Rea appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice of Arrest
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

MUST POST $500.00 CASH. Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.    Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CO-DEFENDANT TYLER SCHEARER.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
See signature bond set 4/19/14
